verses.roman:
kāśī haite calilā teṅho gauḍa-patha diyā
saṅge sevaka cale tāṅra jhāli vahiyā

synonyms: kāśī haite—from Kāśī; calilā—proceeded; teṅho—he; gauḍa-patha diyā—by the path through Bengal; saṅge—along with him; sevaka—one servant; cale—goes; tāṅra—his; jhāli—baggage; vahiyā—carrying.
translation: Accompanied by one servant carrying his baggage, Raghunātha Bhaṭṭa started from Vārāṇasī and traveled along the path leading through Bengal.
